SUMMER in Stockholm

July 20August 15 2015

This summer, join Stockholm Business School for our international summer school. Students from select partner universities are invited to join us in Stockholm, Scandinavia's business and cultural hub, to learn about current topics in business administration.

Four courses will be offered tuition-free over the course of two, two-week sessions. Students are welcome to register for one-two, or two-four sessions, depending on the length of their stay. Each course is worth 6 ECTS credits.

Sign up today!


JULY 20-31 \\ Management technology and representation

What does it mean to know things by numbers? Do management tools describe or construct organizations? This course explores how calculative practices help managers 'know' their organizations and how and why it is that management technologies make organizations, activities, and people available for managerial intervention.

JULY 20-31 \\ Gender, Work and Organisation

The aim of this course is to provide students with intellectual and practical tools necessary for a critical knowledge and understanding of gender issues whilst working in organizations and in selfemployment in both developed and developing country contexts. It will also discuss theories of gender differences and strategies for workplace gender equality.

AUGUST 3-14 \\ Financial Management

The pursuit of the singular goal of shareholder wealth maximization has many interconnected sides. This advanced undergraduate course exposes the student to the essential principles of corporate financial decisionmaking that underpins the shareholder wealth maximization maxim.

AUGUST 3-14 \\ Communicating \\ financial and non- \\ financial information 

This course is centered around two often taken-for-granted concepts; communication and information. Special attention is given to differences in financial and non-financial information and numerical and nonnumerical communications.

For more information visit www.sbs.su.se/summer

Apply by April 7, 2015 by sending your application form available from the exchange coordinator at your home university, to summer@sbs.su.se.
